ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a requirement for the program so its hard to say I recommend it. The course was somewhat disorganized in terms of the guest speakers. I feel like they were never what we expected them to be. I really enjoyed the Sarah Brinegar Lecture, and the man from Yale University Press, however, the two other speakers were not as great. I found myself wishing professor Gordon would just lead those seminars instead. I feel like he is more knowledgeable and would have provided more interesting topics for discussion.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It is a platform to know fellow students work.

I feel like the final paper was a good idea for this course. I loved hearing the ideas and topics that other people were writing about in our final meeting. Such discussions may help me in deciding on a paper topic for next year. I also liked the History lectures we had to go to on Wednesday nights. Most of them were really interesting, and the dinner was good too.
